reviews.text: Well there's only step free access towards Crewe as the Manchester platforms are only accessible via a tall footbridge. Both platforms have seating and shelter and there is a ticket office and ticket machines to boot. There's also a car park with a flat rate of £3 and the person attending the ticket office was really nice and polite. Definitely made my day.
little good to say about it
Small but clean well maintained station with plenty of paid for parking but the rest room was locked
Your completely buggered if your disabled or got babies. There is no access to platforms 2/3 unless you can walk up and down plenty and I mean plenty of steps.

Today at 6.40am the temperature was very near freezing, the ticket office was open but the waiting room on platform 2 was locked, so we had to stand outside waiting for the train in near freezing temperatures!
If staff are on site why is the waiting room on platform 2 locked?
This is quite often the case!
